definition: to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles

sentences.english: Opening my eyes, I saw a big boy glaring at me, a white washcloth in hand.
sentences.chinese: 睁开眼，一个大男孩望着我，手里拿条白色毛巾。

sentences.english: She had an eye-opening experience that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她可是开眼界了。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and via his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睁开眼睛，透过泪水看向他依然捏在手里的绳圈。

sentences.english: eye-opening experiences compared to the atmosphere of the other institution.
sentences.chinese: 与其他大学比起来，这里的氛围使人大开眼界。

sentences.english: Mary grinned at her boyfriend the moment she saw him.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽一看到男友就对他眉开眼笑起来。

sentences.english: And, especially for teenage girls, very eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 而且，特别是对年轻女孩，很开眼界。

sentences.english: After hearing the results of his exam he walked around campus with a smile from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 听到他的考试成绩后，他眉开眼笑地在校园里漫步。
让我给你露一手，开开眼。

sentences.english: The sword did its work quickly, and Abanazar never opened his eyes again.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁手起剑落，阿巴那扎尔就再也没有睁开眼睛了。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大开眼界，拍手叫绝。

sentences.english: This was truly an eye-opening session.
sentences.chinese: 这是真正令人大开眼界的会议。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and through his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睁开眼睛，透过泪水看向他依然捏在手里的绳圈。

sentences.english: Georgiana opened her eyes and looked into the mirror her husband held.
sentences.chinese: 乔治娜睁开眼睛，在丈夫举着的镜子里看着自己。

sentences.english: I opened my eyes, and saw a blue bed-curtain.
sentences.chinese: 我睁开眼睛，见到的是一个帐子。

sentences.english: Listening to him talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 听他谈在中国的历险令人大开眼界。
这次经历让我大开眼界。

definition: see 老天爺|老天爷[lao3 tian1 ye2]
to have eyes/(fig.) to look where one is going/to watch one's step/to be cautious
crow's beak/(fig.) person who makes an inauspicious remark
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
